programs.name: USDA Rural Utility Services
programs.agency: Department of Agriculture: Rural Development
programs.description: Make direct loans and loan guarantees available to electric utilities to serve customers in rural areas for transmission distribution and generation.
programs.eligibility: Alaska Native and tribal corporations | Tribal nonprofit organizations (503-(C)(3))

programs.name: Bio-Refinery Assistance Program
programs.agency: Department of Agriculture: Rural Development
programs.description: Assists in the development of new and emerging technologies for the development of advanced biofuels by providing loan guarantees up to $250 million for the development, construction, and retrofitting of commercial-scale biorefineries and bio-based product manufacturing facilities.

programs.name: Business and Industry Guaranteed Loan Program  (B&I)
programs.agency: Department of Agriculture: Rural Development
programs.description: Aims to improve, develop, or finance business, industry, and employment and improve the economic and environmental climate in rural communities through employment; or reduce reliance on nonrenewable energy resources by encouraging the development and construction of  renewable energy systems.
programs.eligibility: Alaska Native and tribal corporations | Tribal nonprofit organizations (503-(C)(3))

programs.name: Intermediary Relending Program
programs.agency: Department of Agriculture: Rural Development
programs.description: Provides loans to local organizations (intermediaries) for the establishment of revolving loan funds, which are used to assist with financing business and economic development activity to create or retain jobs in disadvantaged and remote communities.
programs.eligibility: Federally recognized Tribes and tribal governments | Tribal energy resource development organizations | Tribal nonprofit organizations (503-(C)(3))

programs.name: Rural Business Enterprise Grants (RBEG) Program
programs.agency: Department of Agriculture: Rural Development
programs.description: Provides grants for rural projects that finance and facilitate development of small and emerging rural businesses, help fund distance learning networks, and help fund employment-related adult education programs.
programs.eligibility: Federally recognized Tribes and tribal governments | Tribal nonprofit organizations (503-(C)(3)) | Tribal energy resource development organizations
programs.filters: pimple tgrant tedu efed etnonprofit eter

programs.name: Rural Development Energy Programs
programs.agency: Department of Agriculture: Rural Development
programs.description: Provides assistance to qualified applicants to finance renewable energy and energy efficiency projects, and expands the existing private credit structure by providing a credit enhancement via a loan guarantee.
programs.type: Grants | Loan and loan guarantee programs
programs.eligibility: Alaska Native and tribal Corporations | Tribal Energy Resource Development Organizations

programs.name: Rural Economic Development Loan and Grant (REDLG)
programs.agency: Department of Agriculture: Rural Development
programs.description: REDLG grantees and borrowers pass the funding on to eligible projects, which can include technical assistance, business incubators, community development assistance, and facilities and equipment.
programs.type: Education and capacity building | Loan and loan guarantee programs | Technical assistance | Grants
programs.eligibility: Tribal universities, utilities, and other organized tribal groups
programs.filters: pimple tgrant tta tedu tloan etu

programs.name: USDA Advanced Biofuel Payment Program
programs.agency: Department of Agriculture: Rural Development
programs.description: Provides payments to eligible producers to support and expand production of advanced biofuels refined from sources other than corn kernel starch.
programs.eligibility: Tribal universities, utilities, and other organized tribal groups

programs.name: USDA Rural Business Enterprise Grants Program
programs.agency: Department of Agriculture: Rural Development
programs.description: Provides grants for rural projects that finance and facilitate development of small and emerging rural businesses to help fund distance learning networks and employment-related adult education programs.
programs.eligibility: Federally recognized Tribes and tribal governments | Tribal nonprofit organizations (503-(C)(3)) | Tribal energy resource development organizations
programs.filters: ppotential tedu tgrant efed etnonprofit eter

programs.name: USDA Rural Energy for America - Energy Audit and Renewable Energy Development Assistance
programs.agency: Department of Agriculture: Rural Development
programs.description: Provides grant assistance to entities that will assist agriculture producers and small rural businesses by conducting energy audits and providing information on renewable energy development assistance.
programs.eligibility: Tribal universities, utilities, and other organized tribal groups

programs.name: Rural Energy for America Program Guaranteed Loan Program (REAP LOANS)
programs.agency: Department of Agriculture: Rural Development
programs.description: Encourages the commercial financing of renewable energy (bioenergy, geothermal, hydrogen, solar, wind, and hydropower) and energy efficiency projects. Under the program, project developers will work with local lenders who can apply for a loan guarantee on up to 85% of the loan amount.
programs.type: Loan and loan guarantee programs | Grants
programs.eligibility: Alaska Native and tribal corporations | Tribal Energy Resource Development Organizations

programs.name: Rural Energy for America Program (REAP)
programs.agency: Department of Agriculture: Rural Development
programs.description: Povides grants to agricultural producers and rural small businesses for energy audits and renewable development assistance.
programs.phase: STEP 4: Project Implementation | STEP 5: Project Operations & Maintenance
programs.type: Technical assistance | Grants | Loan and loan guarantee programs
programs.filters: pimple  pops tta tloan eall tgrant

programs.name: Planning Program and Local Technical Assistance Program
programs.agency: Department of Commerce: Economic Development Administration
programs.description: Provides partnership planning grants to Tribes to help develop and implement comprehensive economic development strategies and associated economic development activities.

programs.name: Public Works and Economic Adjustment Assistance Programs
programs.agency: Department of Commerce: Economic Development Administration
programs.description: Provides support for developing, maintaining, and implementing a comprehensive economic development strategy and related short-term planning activities.

programs.name: Native American Business Development
programs.agency: Department of Commerce: Minority Business Development Administration
programs.description: Provisions direct services to American Indian and Alaska Natives, fosters intergovernmental and industry collaboration, and promotes economic and business development opportunities in Indian Country.
programs.type: Technical assistance | Education and capacity building

programs.name: Advanced Research Projects Agency—Energy (ARPA-E)
programs.agency: Department of Energy: ARPA-E
programs.description: Empowers America�s energy researchers with funding, technical assistance, and market readiness to accelerate the pace of energy innovation.

programs.name: Tribal Affairs Utility Formation
programs.agency: Department of Energy: Bonneville Power Administration
programs.description: Provides technical assistance on establishing a tribal utility in order to sell power to Bonneville Power Administration.
programs.phase: Strategic Energy Planning | STEP 1: Project Potential | STEP 2: Project Options
programs.eligibility: Tribal universities, utilities, and other organized tribal groups

programs.name: Tribal Set-Aside for Low-Income Weatherization
programs.agency: Department of Energy: Bonneville Power Administration
programs.description: Provides funding targeted toward Native American homes to improve the installation of weatherization measures in both Indian Country and throughout the service territory of its public utility customers.
programs.eligibility: All except state-recognized-only Tribes | Tribal energy resource development organizations

programs.name: DOE Unsolicited Proposal Process
programs.agency: Department of Energy: Economic Impact and Diversity
programs.description: Assists DOE and the Office of Economic Impact and Diversity in meeting National Energy Conservation Policy Act mandates to provide technical assistance and opportunities for minorities, minority educational institutions, and minority business enterprises to participate in DOE's energy programs.
programs.type: Education and capacity building | Technical assistance

programs.name: DOE State & Regional Policy Assistance
programs.agency: Department of Energy: Electricity Delivery and Energy Reliability
programs.description: Provides unbiased policy assistance and analysis to states and regions on state electricity policies, programs, laws, and regulations that facilitate electricity infrastructure investment needed to deliver clean, affordable, and reliable electricity to customers.
programs.phase: Strategic Energy Planning | STEP 1: Project Potential
programs.type: Education and capacity building | Technical assistance
programs.eligibility: Federally recognized Tribes and tribal governments

programs.name: Tribal Energy Program
programs.agency: Department of Energy: Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy
programs.description: Offers financial assistance to Tribes to help them deploy renewable energy resources and reduce their energy consumption through efficiency and weatherization.
programs.eligibility: Federally recognized Tribes and tribal governments

programs.name: Weatherization Assistance Program
programs.agency: Department of Energy: Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy
programs.description: Enables low-income families to permanently reduce their energy bills by making their homes more energy efficient.

programs.name: Federal Agency Power Purchases
programs.agency: Department of Energy: Federal Energy Management Program
programs.description: Allows federal agencies to fund on-site renewable energy projects with no up-front capital costs incurred.
programs.eligibility: Tribal universities, utilities, and other organized tribal groups

programs.name: DOE On-Request Technical Assistance
programs.agency: Department of Energy: Indian Energy Policy and Programs
programs.description: Provides up to 40 hours of technical assistance designed to advance tribal renewable energy and energy efficiency projects.
programs.phase: Strategic Energy Planning | STEP 1: Project Potential | STEP 2: Project Options | STEP 3: Project Refinement | STEP 4: Project Implementation
programs.filters: pimple psep ppotential poptions pref tta eallexcept

programs.name: DOE Strategic Technical Assistance Response Team (START) Program
programs.agency: Department of Energy: Indian Energy Policy and Programs
programs.description: Provides selected tribal entities in the 48 contiguous states and Alaska with technical assistance from DOE and national laboratory experts to advance the development and accelerate the implementation of tribal renewable energy projects.

programs.name: Loan Guarantee Program (LPO)
programs.agency: Department of Energy: Loan Guarantee Program Office
programs.description: Supports innovative clean energy technologies that are typically unable to obtain conventional private financing due to high technology risks, including hydrogen, solar, wind/hydropower, nuclear, advanced fossil energy coal, carbon sequestration practices/technologies, electricity delivery and energy reliability, alternative fuel vehicles, industrial energy efficiency projects, and pollution control equipment.

programs.name: Transmission Infrastructure Program
programs.agency: Department of Energy: Western Area Power Administration
programs.description: Provides project development technical assistance to developers and other interested parties who have a proposal to construct new or upgrade existing electric power transmission lines and related facilities.
programs.eligibility: Tribal universities, utilities, and other organized tribal groups

programs.name: Education and Capacity Building
programs.agency: Department of Energy: Indian Energy Policy and Programs
programs.description: Provides education and training resources such as renewable energy online learning, forums, webinars, presentations, and more.
programs.type: Education and capacity building | Technical assistance | Grants

programs.name: Social and Economic Development Strategies Grants
programs.agency: Department of Health and Human Services: ACF/Administration for Native Americans
programs.description: Support locally determined projects designed to reduce or eliminate community problems and achieve community goals.

programs.name: Training and Technical Assistance
programs.agency: Department of Health and Human Services: ACF/Administration for Native Americans
programs.description: Provides training and technical assistance in planning, developing, conducting, and administering ANA projects, short-term in-service training for personnel working on ANA-funded projects, and upon denial of a grant application, technical assistance in revising a grant proposal.
programs.type: Education and capacity building | Technical assistance

programs.name: Water Sense Program
programs.agency: Department of the Interior: Bureau of Reclamation/Department of Energy
programs.description: Supports environmentally responsible projects that increase the generation of reliable hydropower for the nation's electricity supply.
programs.eligibility: Federally recognized Tribes and tribal governments

programs.name: Climate Change Adaptation
programs.agency: Department of the Interior: Bureau of Indian Affairs
programs.description: Provides grants to support tribal planning and assessment efforts for climate change adaptation and mitigation strategies
programs.phase: Strategic Energy Planning | STEP 1: Project Potential
programs.eligibility: Federally recognized Tribes and tribal governments

programs.name: Tribal Energy Development Capacity Grant
programs.agency: Department of the Interior: Indian Energy and Economic Development
programs.description: Assists Tribes in the development of energy resources and further the goal of Indian self-determination.

programs.name: DOI Energy and Mineral Development Program
programs.agency: Department of the Interior: Indian Energy and Economic Development
programs.description: Provides federally recognized Tribes and Indian allottees on trust land with financial assistance to evaluate energy and mineral resource potential on their lands and, in turn, the information they need to promote their lands, negotiate the best agreements with partners or investors, and develop their energy resources.
programs.type: Education and capacity building | Technical assistance | Grants

programs.name: DOI Tribal Energy Development Capacity Grant
programs.agency: Department of the Interior: Indian Energy and Economic Development
programs.description: Develops the tribal managerial, organizational and technical capacity Tribes need to develop or enhance their business and regulatory environment in order to maximize the economic impact of  energy resource development on Indian land.

programs.name: Energy Resource Development, Associated Environmental Impacts, and Mitigation Measures
programs.agency: Department of the Interior: Indian Energy and Economic Development
programs.description: Provides information about energy resource development and associated environmental impacts and mitigation measures; guidance for conducting site-specific environmental assessments and developing monitoring programs; information about applicable federal laws and regulations; and federal and tribal points of contact.

programs.name: Loan Guaranty, Insurance, and Interest Subsidy Program
programs.agency: Department of the Interior: Indian Energy and Economic Development
programs.description: Encourages eligible borrowers to develop viable Indian businesses through conventional lender financing, which helps lenders reduce excessive risks on loans they make and helps borrowers secure conventional financing that might otherwise be unavailable.
programs.eligibility: Federally recognized Tribes and tribal governments

programs.name: Community Development Financial Institutions Fund (CDFI Fund)
programs.agency: Department of the Treasury: CDFI Fund
programs.description: Promotes economic revitalization and community development through investment in and assistance to community development financial institutions.
programs.type: Grants | Loan and loan guarantee programs

programs.name: Community Development Financial Institutions Fund (CDFI Fund) Native Initiatives Native American CDFI Assistance (NACA) Program
programs.agency: Department of the Treasury: CDFI Fund
programs.description: Seeks to increase the access to credit, capital, and financial services in Native communities through the creation and expansion of CDFIs primarily serving Native communities.
programs.type: Grants | Loan and loan guarantee programs

programs.name: Community Development Financial Institutions Fund (CDFI Fund) New Markets Tax Credit  (NMTC) Program
programs.agency: Department of the Treasury: CDFI Fund
programs.description: Helps small- and medium-sized businesses in low-income communities access financing that is flexible and affordable. Financing from CDEs can apply to a wide range of projects, including housing developments, renewable energy installations, and facilities that provide community services.
programs.eligibility: Federally recognized Tribes and tribal governments | Tribal energy resource development organizations | Alaska Native and tribal corporations

programs.name: Qualified Energy Conservation Bonds (QECBs)
programs.agency: Department of the Treasury: Energy Efficiency and Renewable Energy
programs.description: Enables qualified state, tribal, and local government issuers to borrow money at attractive rates to fund energy conservation projects.
programs.eligibility: Federally recognized Tribes and tribal governments

programs.name: Clean Renewable Energy Bonds ("New CREBs")
programs.agency: Department of the Treasury: Internal Revenue Service
programs.description: Issues tax-credit bonds to deploy renewable energy projects.
programs.eligibility: Federally recognized Tribes and tribal governments

programs.name: Partnership for Sustainable Communities
programs.agency: Environmental Protection Agency/Department of Housing and Urban Development/Department of Transportation
programs.description: Aids places around the country in developing in more environmentally and economically sustainable ways.
programs.type: Education and capacity building | Technical assistance

programs.name: Clean Energy Programs (ENERGY STAR, State and Local Climate and Energy Program, and Combined Heat & Power Partnership)
programs.agency: Environmental Protection Agency: Air and Radiation/Atmospheric Programs
programs.description: Helps energy consumers and clean energy stakeholders learn about energy efficiency, renewable energy, and combined heat and power and related policy options by providing objective information and resources, creating networks between the public and private sector, and providing technical assistance.

programs.name: Green Power Partnership
programs.agency: Environmental Protection Agency: Air and Radiation/Atmospheric Programs
programs.description: Supports the organizational procurement of green power by offering expert advice, technical support, tools, and resources that can help lower the transaction costs of buying green power and communicate leadership to key stakeholders.
programs.type: Information resources | Education and capacity building

programs.name: Diesel Emissions Reduction National Funding Assistance Program
programs.agency: Environmental Protection Agency: Air and Radiation/Transportation and Air Quality
programs.description: Offers sector-specific rebate opportunities, as well as eligible tribal and nontribal competitive grant opportunities to help fund diesel emissions reducing engine projects.
programs.eligibility: Federally recognized Tribes and tribal governments

programs.name: Brownfields Development - Technical Assistance Grants
programs.agency: Environmental Protection Agency: Solid Waste and Emergency Response/Brownfields and Land Revitalization
programs.description: Provide technical assistance to local stakeholders, including Tribes, through the technical assistance to Brownfields Communities Program.
programs.type: Education and capacity building | Technical assistance

programs.name: Brownfields Development - ARC, AWP, JT Grants
programs.agency: Environmental Protection Agency: Solid Waste and Emergency Response/Brownfields and Land Revitalization
programs.description: Provide direct funding for brownfields assessment, revolving loan fund, and cleanup (ARC); area wide planning (AWP); and environmental job training (JT) grants.
programs.type: Education and capacity building | Technical assistance

programs.name: RE-Powering America's Land
programs.agency: Environmental Protection Agency: Solid Waste and Emergency Response/Center for Program Analysis
programs.description: Identifies the renewable energy potential of current and formerly contaminated lands, landfills, and mine sites and provides other useful resources for communities, developers, industry, state, and local governments, or anyone interested in reusing these sites for renewable energy development, when such development aligns with the community's vision for the site.
programs.type: Education and capacity building | Technical assistance

programs.name: Healthy Homes Production Program
programs.agency: Housing and Urban Development: Lead Hazard Control and Healthy Homes
programs.description: Supports projects that identify and correct significant housing-related health and safety hazards in privately owned, low-income rental, or owner-occupied housing.
programs.eligibility: Federally recognized Tribes and tribal governments

programs.name: 504 Loan Program
programs.agency: Small Business Administration
programs.description: Provides growing businesses with long-term, fixed-rate financing for major fixed assets, such as land and buildings.
programs.phase: STEP 1: Project Potential | STEP 4: Project Implementation

programs.name: 7(a) Loan Program
programs.agency: Small Business Administration
programs.description: Provides business loans to American small businesses, proceeds from which may generally be used to establish a new business or to assist in the operation, acquisition, or expansion of an existing business.
programs.phase: STEP 1: Project Potential | STEP 4: Project Implementation

programs.name: Community Advantage
programs.agency: Small Business Administration
programs.description: Offer a streamlined application process for SBA 7(a) loans up to $250,000.
programs.phase: STEP 1: Project Potential | STEP 4: Project Implementation

programs.name: Export Express
programs.agency: Small Business Administration
programs.description: Offers financing up to $500,000, in the form of a term loan or a revolving line of credit, through a simple, streamlined application process; loan proceeds may be used for business purposes that will enhance a company�s export development.
programs.phase: STEP 1: Project Potential | STEP 4: Project Implementation

programs.name: Microloan Program
programs.agency: Small Business Administration
programs.description: Provides loans up to $50,000 to help small businesses and certain not-for-profit childcare centers start up and expand.
programs.phase: STEP 1: Project Potential | STEP 4: Project Implementation

programs.name: SBA Express
programs.agency: Small Business Administration
programs.description: Features an accelerated turnaround time for SBA review, with a response to an application given within 36 hours. Maximum loan amount is $350,000.
programs.phase: STEP 1: Project Potential | STEP 4: Project Implementation

programs.name: Indian Environmental General Assistance Program
programs.agency: Environmental Protection Agency—Region 9
programs.description: The goal of the General Assistance Program (GAP) is to assist tribes in developing the capacity to plan and establish environmental protection programs and to develop and implement solid and hazardous waste programs in accordance with their individual needs.
programs.eligibility: Federally recognized Tribes and tribal governments
